div.p: STRYCHNOS, in botany : A genus of plants belonging to the claſs of pentandria, and order of mοnogynia ; and in the natural ſyſtem ranging under the 28th order, Lurida. The corolla is quinqueſid ; the berry is unilocular, with a woody bark. The ſpecies are three, the nux vomica, colubrina, and potatorum, natives of foreign countries.
